project.teaser: The rail freight sector is facing a multitude of challenges such as lack of network capacity and productivity. Manual processes still entail worker’s safety risks. Rail must adopt the emerging digital technologies to meet the customer needs. FP5-TRANS4M-R brings together 71...
project.objective: The rail freight sector is facing a multitude of challenges such as lack of network capacity and productivity. Manual processes still entail worker’s safety risks. Rail must adopt the emerging digital technologies to meet the customer needs. FP5-TRANS4M-R brings together 71 partners from end-users, large industry, railway undertakings – operators and wagon keepers, SMEs, academia and research, delivering on the rail freight sector’s commitment to increase of the modal split share to 50% by 2030 revoking the causality between economic growth in Europe and pollution as well as congestions, positively impacting Europe’s citizens quality of life. FP5-TRANS4M-R’s overall goal is to establish rail freight as backbone of the lowest emission and most resilient logistics chain in Europe fulfilling the end customer requirements to their full satisfaction. Two technology clusters “Full Digital Freight Train Operation (FDFTO)” and “Seamless Freight Operation” will develop, validate and demonstrate the FP5-TRANS4M-R technologies following an integrated systemic approach across the sector, in a competitive manner - as only then the expected automation benefits can be fully realised. Integrating DAC-enabled solutions at non- arguable interoperability with software defined systems and digital rail services will lead to increased capacity, higher throughput and shorter transportation duration. It will strengthen the cross-border coordination and cooperation between rail infrastructure managers and finally deliver optimised overall management of the rail network. FP5-TRANS4M-R's credo is: seamless, integrated, interoperable, validated and EU-wide authorised solutions, to achieve a single EU rail freight technology framework with strictly managed interfaces for an effective system integration and seamless operation across countries, actors and modes. These objectives set the foundation, frame, and ambition for the project with an impact on the overall transport and logistics sector in EU.
project.title: Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 5 - Transforming Europe’s Rail Freight
project.keywords: digital rail services, digital autonomous coupler, yard management solutions

article.title: Fully digital and seamless freight operations transform Europe’s rail freight

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Conceptual Design of Shunting Automation Elements Utilising the Digital Automatic Coupler

details.authors: G.S. Himmelbauer, T. Hasenleithner, M. Egger, B. Skok, A. Kaltenbrunner, B. Stadlmann
details.journalTitle: Civil-Comp Conferences, Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference on Railway Technology: Research, Development and Maintenance

result.title: D5 5 Requirements Specification Yard Automation
result.description: - Stakeholder analysis document, Operational concept with use cases- System architecture description- Catalogue of trackside technical requirements for shunting (e.g. automated stationary brake tests, stationary parking brake functions and solutions for decoupling on the hump)- Catalogue of technical requirements for automated shunting movement without ETCS (radio control, localization, CCS interface)- Catalogue of required amendments to TAF-TSI (and other standards)- Interface and protocols specifications (incl. FA2 and FA3 as well as European Railway Checkpoints)

details.authors: David Krüger, Mathilde Laporte, Jonan Morales, Iñigo Adin, Björn Pålsson, Behzad Kordnejad, Ingrid Nordmark

result.title: D2 3 Reference Freight System Architecture
result.description: Report on the overall FDFT System Architecture

On Wayside Detector Measurement of Wheel-Rail Impact Loads Induced by Wheel Flats - Data Analysis, Alarm Levels and Regulations

details.authors: K. Mattsson, J.C.O. Nielsen, L. Fehrlund, M. Maglio, T. Vernersson
details.journalTitle: Civil-Comp Conferences, Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference on Railway Technology: Research, Development and Maintenance

result.title: D18 1 Test report for Powerline PLUS technology
D25 3 Report on the basic functional and technical specifications regarding CMS as relevant input for FP3
result.description: Report on the basic functional and technical specifications regarding CMS as relevant input for FP3

result.title: D25 2 Report on the basic functional and technical specifications for Seamless Planning Dynamic Dispatching and Intermodal Prediction as relevant input for FP1
result.description: Report on the basic functional and technical specifications for Seamless Planning, Dynamic Dispatching and Intermodal Prediction as relevant input for FP1

result.title: D29 1 Technical definition of the standard IVG for checkpoints and related demonstrators
result.description: This report will cover the following topics: demonstrator definition and start of development, prioritization of use cases and mitigation of regulatory barriers for harmonized procedures.

result.title: D2 2 FDFTO User Requirements Specification
D27 1 Cartography
result.description: Cartography of customer requirements mapped to modules defined and specified in the specification phase.

result.title: D25 1 Report on the basic functional and technical specifications for the realisation of the technical enablers of Seamless Freight also including the final specification input for FP1
result.description: The deliverable contains the functional and technical specifications on enabler level. also including the final specification input for FP1. It follows the framework established in WP2. The report is structured according to the different enablers, with Seamless Planning and Dynamic Dispatching containing input which is used by different WPs in SG2 of the Destination FA1 project. will identify the data and use cases that can be shared with FP3. This will be in line with D7.2. BIS of FP3 in M13 “Analysis of the connection to FA5” which will identify the data that FP3 will request from FP5. Sharing of data is identified as a risk and mitigation strategies will be adopted.

result.title: Digital Automatic Coupling as an Enabler for Rail Freight InnovationsPatrick Seeßle, Daniel Wolfram, Andreas Haller, Florian Einsele, Victoria Jäger, Simon Funke

details.authors: Patrick Seeßle, Daniel Wolfram, Andreas Haller, Florian Einsele, Victoria Jäger, Simon Funke
details.journalTitle: Transport Transitions: Advancing Sustainable and Inclusive Mobility, Proceedings of the 10th TRA Conference, 2024, Dublin, Ireland - Volume 2: Sustainable Transport Development

result.title: D4 1 Authorisation strategy and overall safety plan
result.description: Authorisation strategy and overall safety plan

result.title: D32 2 Recommendations to reduce technical barriers and improve the quality and availability of data - Report
result.description: Recommendations to reduce technical barriers and improve the quality and availability of data (report).

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
